CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 17 reads: "Open To Serve - A health and welfare center recently was opened by Ethnan Temple Seventh Day Adventist Church, 662 Bryn Mawr Rd., Pittsburgh. Left to right: Mmes. Louise Davis, Ellen Allesberry, Win Thomas, G. Woods, E. Washington, Marjorie Randolph and Alberta Peterson.  in door: Councilman James A. Jordon, Mrs. Eunice Cook, who served as mistress of ceremonies, and Elder Nelson Bloss, pastor.  Right side of door: Mrs. Bessie Mathison, leader of the center; Charles Thompkins, first aid director; Mmes. Mae Berry, Belle Bates and Madge Harris.  Back row: Mmes. Sallie Williams, Pauline Jackson, Elizabeth Campbell and Dorothea Taylor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group, many wearing service uniforms, including left side: Louise Davis, Ellen Allesberry, Win Thomas, G. Woods, E. Washington, Marjorie Randolph, Alberta Peterson; right side: Bessie Mathison, Charles Thompkins, Mae Berry, Belle Bates, and Madge Harris; back row: Sallie Williams, Pauline Jackson, Elizabeth Campbell, and Dorothea Taylor, gathered for opening of Seventh Day Adventist Health Welfare Center, with Councilman James "Jim" A. Jordon, Eunice Cook, and Elder Nelson Bloss, standing in doorway cutting ribbon
